sen.j: 五代目 中村 歌右衛門（ごだいめ なかむら うたえもん、慶応元年12月29日 (旧暦)（1866年2月14日） - 昭和15年（1940年）9月12日）は、明治から大正、昭和の戦前期にかけて活躍した歌舞伎役者。
sen.e: A fifth-generation Utaemon NAKAMURA (February 14, 1866 - September 12, 1940) is a kabuki actor who was active in Meiji, Taisho and the prewar period of Showa.
The fifth Utaemon NAKAMURA (February 14, 1866 - September 12, 1940) was a kabuki actor who was active in the Meiji period and the Taisho period and the prewar period of the Showa period.
sen.cmt: 表記を統一、文法ミスがあります。
sen.e: The fifth Utaemon NAKAMURA (February 14, 1866 - September 12, 1940) was a kabuki actor who was active in the Meiji period and the Taisho period and the prewar period of the Showa period.

sen.j: 本名中村栄太郎。
sen.e: Real name is Eitaro NAKAMURA.
His real name was Eitaro NAKAMURA.
His real name was Eitaro NAKAMURA.

sen.j: 俳名は魁玉、中村梅玉、梅苔。
sen.e: Haimyo (stage name used officially and privately) is Kaigyoku, Baigyoku NAKAMURA and Umegoke.
sen.cmt: 梅苔の読みは、植物の梅苔と同じくウメゴケとしましたが、俳名としても同様の読み方かどうかは不明です。Ｓ
sen.e: His haimyo (stage name used officially and privately) was Kaigyoku, Baigyoku NAKAMURA and Umegoke.
His haimyo (stage name used officially and privately) was Kaigyoku, Baigyoku NAKAMURA and Umegoke.

sen.j: 屋号は成駒屋。
sen.e: Yago (stage family name) is Narikomaya.
His yago (stage family name) was Narikoma-ya.
sen.cmt: 時制を統一します。屋号表記はよく使用されるかたちにします。
sen.e: His yago (stage family name) was Narikoma-ya.

sen.j: 幕府の金座役人の子として江戸本所請地に生まれる。
sen.e: He was born of kinza (an organization in charge of casting and appraising of gold during the Edo period) officer of bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) in Edo Honjo Ukeji.
He was born as son of an official of the shogunate's kinza (one of mints during the Edo period) in Honjo-ukechi of Edo (Tokyo).
sen.cmt: 固有名詞読み間違い、訳語選択ミスがあります。
sen.e: He was born as son of an official of the shogunate's kinza (one of mints during the Edo period) in Honjo-ukechi of Edo (Tokyo).

sen.j: 1875年（明治8年）中村芝翫 (4代目)の養子となり、初代中村児太郎として二年後の1877年（明治10年）甲府三井座で『伊勢音頭』の油屋息子役で初舞台。
sen.e: He was adopted by Shikan NAKAMURA (a forth generation) in 1875 and two years later, as Kotaro NAKAMURA the first he made his stage debut by playing the role of an Aburaya's son in "Ise Ondo" at Kofu Mitsui-za Theater in 1877.

He was adopted by Shikan NAKAMURA (the forth) in 1875, and two years later, as Kotaro NAKAMURA (the first) he made his stage debut at Mitsui-za Theater of Kofu in 1877, playing the role of Aburaya-Musuko (son of the oil seller) in "Ise Ondo."
sen.cmt: 訳語選択ミスがあります。
sen.e: He was adopted by Shikan NAKAMURA (the forth) in 1875, and two years later, as Kotaro NAKAMURA (the first) he made his stage debut at Mitsui-za Theater of Kofu in 1877, playing the role of Aburaya-Musuko (son of the oil seller) in "Ise Ondo."

sen.j: 1881年（明治14年）『扇屋熊谷』の桂子で四代目中村福助を襲名。
sen.e: In 1881, he succeeded to the name of the forth Fukusuke NAKAMURA by playing the role of Katsurako in "Ogiya Kumagai."
In 1881, he succeeded to the name of the forth Fukusuke NAKAMURA by playing the role of Katsurako in "Ogiya Kumagai."
In 1881, he succeeded to the name of the forth Fukusuke NAKAMURA by playing the role of Katsurako in "Ogiya Kumagai."

sen.j: 生まれついての美貌と品のある芸風で新進気鋭の若手として東京、大阪で人気を集め、1884年（明治17年）市川團十郎 (9代目)の『助六』で揚巻役に抜擢され、以降團十郎や尾上菊五郎 (5代目)の相手を務める。
sen.e: As he won popularity in Osaka and Tokyo with natural beauty and elegant style of performance, he was selected for the part of Agemaki in "Sukeroku" of Danjuro ICHIKAWA (the ninth-generation) and he co-starred with Danjuro and Kikugoro ONOE (the fifth-generation) afterwards.

As he won popularity in Osaka and Tokyo with natural beauty and elegant style of performance, he was selected for the part of Agemaki in "Sukeroku" ("Sukeroku Yukari no Edozakura") when Danjuro ICHIKAWA (the ninth) played the leading character, and after that, he co-starred with Danjuro and with Kikugoro ONOE (the fifth) as female impersonator.

As he won popularity in Osaka and Tokyo with natural beauty and elegant style of performance, he was selected for the part of Agemaki in "Sukeroku" ("Sukeroku Yukari no Edozakura") when Danjuro ICHIKAWA (the ninth) played the leading character, and after that, he co-starred with Danjuro and with Kikugoro ONOE (the fifth) as female impersonator.

sen.j: さらに1887年（明治20年）の井上馨邸での天覧歌舞伎に出演するなど、歌舞伎界の次世代を担うリーダーとして将来を嘱望される。
sen.e: Also in 1887, he played in the kabuki held in the presence of the Emperor at the residence of Kaoru INOUE so that he was expected his future to become a leader in the next generation of kabuki world.
Also in 1887, he played in the kabuki held in the presence of the Emperor at the residence of Kaoru INOUE so that he was expected his future to become a leader in the next generation of kabuki world.
Also in 1887, he played in the kabuki held in the presence of the Emperor at the residence of Kaoru INOUE so that he was expected his future to become a leader in the next generation of kabuki world.

sen.j: 1901年（明治34年）5月『六歌仙』の小町、『楼門五三桐』の石川五右衛門などで五代目中村芝翫を襲名。
sen.e: In May, 1901, he played the part of Komachi in "Rokkasen"(six famous poets of the Heian period), Goemon ISHIKAWA in "Sanmon Gosan no Kiri" and so on to succeed the name of the fifth Shikan NAKAMURA.

In May, 1901, he played the part of Komachi in "Rokkasen" ("Rokkasen Sugata no Irodori"), and the part of Goemon ISHIKAWA in "Sanmon Gosan no Kiri" and so on, and succeeded to the name of the fifth Shikan NAKAMURA.
sen.cmt: 文法を直します。この記事においては歌舞伎のタイトルの訳は重要ではなく、説明困難なタイトルが多くありますので、括弧説明を省略します。
sen.e: In May, 1901, he played the part of Komachi in "Rokkasen" ("Rokkasen Sugata no Irodori"), and the part of Goemon ISHIKAWA in "Sanmon Gosan no Kiri" and so on, and succeeded to the name of the fifth Shikan NAKAMURA.

sen.j: 1904年（明治37年）3月、歌舞伎座で坪内逍遥作の戯曲『桐一葉』を初演。
sen.e: In March, 1904, he performed a play "Kiri Hitoha" made by Shoyo TSUBOUCHI the first time at Kabuki-za Theater.
In March, 1904, he first performed "Kiri Hitoha" written by Shoyo TSUBOUCHI at the Kabuki-za Theater.
sen.cmt: 訳語選択ミスがあります。
sen.e: In March, 1904, he first performed "Kiri Hitoha" written by Shoyo TSUBOUCHI at the Kabuki-za Theater.

sen.j: 淀殿を演じて大評判となり以後彼の当り役となる。
sen.e: He played the part of Yodo-dono which caused a great sensation and became his successful role afterwards.
In that, he played the female part of Yodo-dono which caused a great sensation and became his successful role afterwards.
In that, he played the female part of Yodo-dono which caused a great sensation and became his successful role afterwards.

sen.j: 1911年（明治44年）11月東京歌舞伎座で『京鹿子娘道成寺』の花子で五代目中村歌右衛門を襲名。
sen.e: In November, 1911, he played the part of Hanako in "Kyo Kanokomusume Dojoji (The maiden at Dojo-ji Temple)" to succeed the name of the fifth Utaemon NAKAMURA at Tokyo Kabuki-za Theater.
In November, 1911, he played the part of Hanako in "Kyoganoko Musume Dojoji" at the Kabuki-za Theater of Tokyo and succeeded to the name of the fifth Utaemon NAKAMURA.
sen.cmt: 訳語選択ミスがあります。「京鹿子…」は「きょうがのこ」で切れます（登録用語は間違い）。
sen.e: In November, 1911, he played the part of Hanako in "Kyoganoko Musume Dojoji" at the Kabuki-za Theater of Tokyo and succeeded to the name of the fifth Utaemon NAKAMURA.

sen.j: このとき、大阪の中村鴈治郎 (初代)と歌右衛門の継承を巡って争う。
sen.e: He fought about a succession of Utaemon with Ganjiro NAKAMURA (the first-generation) on this occasion.
At that occasion, he had fought about the succession of Utaemon with Ganjiro NAKAMURA (the first) of Osaka.
sen.cmt: 訳漏れ、文法ミスがあります。
sen.e: At that occasion, he had fought about the succession of Utaemon with Ganjiro NAKAMURA (the first) of Osaka.

sen.j: 「團菊左」亡きあとの歌舞伎界の最高峰となり、市村羽左衛門 (15代目)、片岡仁左衛門 (11代目)とともに「三衛門」と呼ばれた。
sen.e: He became the greatest actor in kabuki world after 'Dankikusa' died and was called 'three Emon' with Uzaemon ICHIMURA (the fifteenth-generation) and Nizaemon KATAOKA (the eleventh-generation).

After the three famous actors 'Dan-Giku-Sa' had died, he became the top actor in kabuki world and was called one of 'San-Emon' (three best actors with 'emon') along with Uzaemon ICHIMURA (the fifth) and Nizaemon KATAOKA (the eleventh).
sen.cmt: 訳語選択ミス、固有名詞読み間違いがあります。「團菊佐」は「だんぎくさ」と通常濁って読みます。
sen.e: After the three famous actors 'Dan-Giku-Sa' had died, he became the top actor in kabuki world and was called one of 'San-Emon' (three best actors with 'emon') along with Uzaemon ICHIMURA (the fifth) and Nizaemon KATAOKA (the eleventh).

sen.j: 歌舞伎座幹部技芸委員長の要職を勤め技術の向上や技芸の伝承に尽くした。
sen.e: He assumed an important post as chief of the executive artistry committee of Kabuki-za Theatrical Corporation and administered to improve the technique and hand down the arts.

He assumed the important position of the chairman of the artistry committee of the Kabuki-za Theater, and contributed richly for the improvement of the actors' technique and for the succession of the arts.

He assumed the important position of the chairman of the artistry committee of the Kabuki-za Theater, and contributed richly for the improvement of the actors' technique and for the succession of the arts.

sen.j: 1931年（昭和6年）10月の歌舞伎座で鴈治郎と共演した『山門』の五右衛門が、東西成駒屋の火花を散らす共演として有名。
sen.e: The part of Goemon in "San-mon Gate" co-starred with Ganjiro at Kabuki-za Theater in October, 1931, is famous as co-star of to-zai (East and West) Narikomaya making the sparks fly.

In October, 1931, he co-starred with Ganjiro at the Kabuki-za Theater, playing the role of Goemon in "Sanmon" (the scene of 'Nanzenji Sanmon' of "Sanmon Gosan no Kiri"), which became famous as the top actor of the East Narikoma-ya (Utaemon from Tokyo) and the top actor of the West Narikoma-ya (Ganjiro from Osaka) had made the sparks fly on the stage.
sen.cmt: 訳語選択ミスがあります。
sen.e: In October, 1931, he co-starred with Ganjiro at the Kabuki-za Theater, playing the role of Goemon in "Sanmon" (the scene of 'Nanzenji Sanmon' of "Sanmon Gosan no Kiri"), which became famous as the top actor of the East Narikoma-ya (Utaemon from Tokyo) and the top actor of the West Narikoma-ya (Ganjiro from Osaka) had made the sparks fly on the stage.

sen.j: また、晩年の1936年（昭和11年）11月歌舞伎座で行われた「三代目中村歌右衛門百年祭」には東西の幹部俳優が集まり、『日招きの清盛』では総勢九十名の出演者の真ん中に王者のように座して平清盛を演じたが、その立派さは後世の語り草となっている（近年、その舞台のフィルムが発見された）。
sen.e: Besides, to-zai executive actors gathered for 'the 100th anniversary of the third Utaemon NAKAMURA' held at Kabuki-za Theater in November, 1936 in his later years and his praiseworthy performance of TAIRA no Kiyomori in "Himaneki no Kiyomori" sitting like a king in the middle of 90 performers in all is talked about even by later generations.

Besides, in his later years, 'the 100th anniversary of the third Utaemon NAKAMURA' held at the Kabuki-za Theater in November of 1936 and top actors of the East and of the West all gathered and performed "Himaneki no Kiyomori" with the total of ninety actors, Utaemon played the leading role TAIRA no Kiyomori, sitting like a king at the middle of the ninety performers; his brilliant performance on the stage has been still told among people (the film recording the stage was found resently).
sen.cmt: 訳語選択ミスがあります。わかりやすくします。
sen.e: Besides, in his later years, 'the 100th anniversary of the third Utaemon NAKAMURA' held at the Kabuki-za Theater in November of 1936 and top actors of the East and of the West all gathered and performed "Himaneki no Kiyomori" with the total of ninety actors, Utaemon played the leading role TAIRA no Kiyomori, sitting like a king at the middle of the ninety performers; his brilliant performance on the stage has been still told among people (the film recording the stage was found resently).

sen.j: 鉛毒が元での不自由な身体を押して舞台に立ち「東西随一の女形」と呼ばれた。
sen.e: He was called 'the best actor of female roles in to-zai' as he went on the stage in spite of physical disability caused by lead poisoning.
He was called 'the best female impersonator in the East and the West' as he went on the stage in spite of physical disability caused by lead poisoning.
He was called 'the best female impersonator in the East and the West' as he went on the stage in spite of physical disability caused by lead poisoning.

sen.j: 動かない身体を台詞回しの巧さでカバーし観客を陶酔させた。
sen.e: He covered the unmoving body by the skill of his elocution, which fascinated theater audience.
He compensated the unmoving body by the enormous skill of delivering his lines, which fascinated theater audience.
sen.cmt: 訳語選択ミスがあります。
sen.e: He compensated the unmoving body by the enormous skill of delivering his lines, which fascinated theater audience.

sen.j: 幾つかの当り役はレコードに吹き込まれており今日でも聴く事ができる。
sen.e: Some of his successful roles were recorded on records to be able to listen today.
Some of his successful roles were recorded on records which can be listened today.
Some of his successful roles were recorded on records which can be listened today.

sen.j: 当り役は非常に多く、時代物では『本朝廿四孝・十種香』の八重垣姫、『鎌倉三代記・絹川村』の時姫、『祇園祭礼信仰記・金閣寺』の雪姫（三つ合わせて三姫）、『伽羅先代萩』の政岡・世話物では『助六』の揚巻、『籠釣瓶』の八つ橋、『新版歌祭文・野崎村』のお光、新作では前述の淀君などがある。
sen.e: There are so many successful roles such as, in historical drama, Yaegaki-hime in "Jusshuko (Incense Burning), Honcho Niju-shi ko" (24 Paragons of Filial Piety of our Country), Tokihime in "Kamakura Sandaiki" (Three Generations of the Kamakura Shogunate), Yukihime in "Gion Sairei Shinkoki, Kinkakuji" (Gion Honoring Story, Golden Pavilion) (three of them were called Mitsuhime [three princesses] together), Masaoka in "Meiboku Sendai Hagi" (The Disputed Succession of the Date Family), in plays dealing with the lives of ordinary people, Agemaki in "Sukeroku", Yatsuhashi in "Kagotsurube", Omitsu in "Shinpan Utazaimon (The Love of Osome and Hisamatsu), Nozaki-mura Village" and in a new work, Yodogimi mentioned above and so on.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: He had so many successful roles; as for jidai-mono (historical drama), Yaegaki-hime in the scene of 'Jusshuko' of "Honcho Nijushi-Ko," Toki-hime in 'Kinugawa-mura' of "Kamakura Sandaiki," Yuki-hime in 'Kinkakuji' of "Gion Sairei Shinko-ki" (those three roles were called Mitsuhime [three princesses]), and Masaoka in "Meiboku Sendai Hagi"; as for sewa-mono (drama based on real-life people), Agemaki in "Sukeroku," Yatsuhashi in "Kagotsurube" ("Kagotsurube Sato no Yoizame," Omitsu in 'Nozaki-mura' of "Shinpan Utazaimon"; as for modern play, Yodogimi mentioned above and so on.
sen.cmt: 訳語選択ミス、訳漏れがあります。
sen.e: He had so many successful roles; as for jidai-mono (historical drama), Yaegaki-hime in the scene of 'Jusshuko' of "Honcho Nijushi-Ko," Toki-hime in 'Kinugawa-mura' of "Kamakura Sandaiki," Yuki-hime in 'Kinkakuji' of "Gion Sairei Shinko-ki" (those three roles were called Mitsuhime [three princesses]), and Masaoka in "Meiboku Sendai Hagi"; as for sewa-mono (drama based on real-life people), Agemaki in "Sukeroku," Yatsuhashi in "Kagotsurube" ("Kagotsurube Sato no Yoizame," Omitsu in 'Nozaki-mura' of "Shinpan Utazaimon"; as for modern play, Yodogimi mentioned above and so on.

sen.j: これら女形が今日にまで演技の手本となっているほどである。
sen.e: There female roles are models of performance even today.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Those female roles are still considered to be models of performance today.
Those female roles are still considered to be models of performance today.

sen.j: また立役では、前述の五右衛門のほか、若き日に明治天皇臨席の天覧劇で演じた『勧進帳』の源義経、『寿曽我対面』の工藤、『暫』のウケ、『菅原伝授手習鑑・車引』の時平、『双蝶々曲輪日記・角力場』の濡髪なども堂々たる押しだしで見事にこなした。
sen.e: As tachiyaku (a leading male-role actor), he performed grandly with a dignified appearance, besides Goemon mentioned above, MINAMOTO no Yoshitsune in "Kanjincho" played in the presence of the Emperor Meiji in his youth, Kudo in "Kotobuki Soga no Taimen" (confront with the ememy), Uke in "Shibaraku", Tokihira in "Sugawara Denju Tenarai Kagami: Kurumabiki (Sugawara's secrets of calligraphy: Kurumabiki episode), Nuregami in "Futatsu Chocho Kuruwa Nikki: Sumoba" (A Diary of Two Butterflies in the Pleasure Quarters: Wrestling scene).

As for tachi-yaku (male role), he performed grandly with a dignified appearance; besides Goemon mentioned above, his well-known tachi-yaku were MINAMOTO no Yoshitsune in "Kanjincho" which he had performed in his younger days in the presence of Emperor Meiji, and Kudo in "Kotobuki Soga no Taimen," Uke in "Shibaraku," Shihei in 'Kuruma-biki' of "Sugawara Denju Tenarai Kagami," and Nuregami in 'Sumo-ba' of "Futatsu-chocho Kuruwa Nikki."
sen.cmt: 訳語選択ミスがあります。固有名詞読み間違い、「時平」は「しへい」。
sen.e: As for tachi-yaku (male role), he performed grandly with a dignified appearance; besides Goemon mentioned above, his well-known tachi-yaku were MINAMOTO no Yoshitsune in "Kanjincho" which he had performed in his younger days in the presence of Emperor Meiji, and Kudo in "Kotobuki Soga no Taimen," Uke in "Shibaraku," Shihei in 'Kuruma-biki' of "Sugawara Denju Tenarai Kagami," and Nuregami in 'Sumo-ba' of "Futatsu-chocho Kuruwa Nikki."

sen.j: 実子に夭折した中村福助 (5代目)、中村歌右衛門 (6代目)がいる。
sen.e: His children were Fukusuke NAKAMURA who died young (the fifth-generation) and Utaemon NAKAMURA (the sixth-generation).
His children were Fukusuke NAKAMURA (the fifth) who died young and Utaemon NAKAMURA (the sixth).
His children were Fukusuke NAKAMURA (the fifth) who died young and Utaemon NAKAMURA (the sixth).

sen.j: また生涯の当り役となった淀君の狂言を集めた家の芸「淀君集」をまとめた（『桐一葉』『沓手鳥孤城落月』『淀君』『醍醐の春』『大阪嬢』『淀君小田原陣』）。
sen.e: Also he gathered the art handed down from father to son 'Yodogimi shu' which collected Kyogen (farce played during a Noh cycle) of the successful role in his life, Yodogimi. ("Kiri Hitoha"(a leaf of paulownia), "Yodogimi", "Daigo no Haru"(spring in Daigo), "Osaka-jo"(young lady in Osaka) and "Yodogimi Odawara no Jin".

Also he compiled 'Yodogimi shu' as the arts should be handed down to his family, collecting Kyogen (kabuki play) of Yodogimi which was his successful role in his life ("Kiri Hitoha," "Hototogisu Kojo no Rakugetsu," "Yodogimi," "Daigo no Haru," "Osaka-jo," and "Yodogimi Odawara no Jin").
sen.cmt: 訳漏れ、誤訳があります。訳語選択ミス、「狂言」はこの場合「歌舞伎」のことです。
sen.e: Also he compiled 'Yodogimi shu' as the arts should be handed down to his family, collecting Kyogen (kabuki play) of Yodogimi which was his successful role in his life ("Kiri Hitoha," "Hototogisu Kojo no Rakugetsu," "Yodogimi," "Daigo no Haru," "Osaka-jo," and "Yodogimi Odawara no Jin").

sen.j: 始めの計画では十種の予定であったが六種にとどまった。
sen.e: The first plan was 10 kinds of plays, but no more than 6 gathered.
Initially he planned to collect ten plays, however, compiled only six plays..
Initially he planned to collect ten plays, however, compiled only six plays..

sen.j: 東西歌舞伎の重鎮らしく、東京千駄ヶ谷の自宅は三千坪の敷地に二百坪の屋敷（門から母屋まで３０ｍ）という壮大なもので、多数の使用人と警備の警官まで備えていた。
sen.e: Like a grand person of to-zai kabuki, his grand residence that had 9900sq.m. of premises and 660sq.m. of residence (30m from the gate to the main housing) and was provided many servants and policemen for the security in Sendagaya, Tokyo Prefecture.

As an influential person of kabuki world of the East and the West, his residence of Sendagaya of Tokyo had the premises of 9900 sq.m. and the residence of 660 sq.m. (it was 30 meters from the gate to the main housing), and was provided many servants and even policemen for the security.

As an influential person of kabuki world of the East and the West, his residence of Sendagaya of Tokyo had the premises of 9900 sq.m. and the residence of 660 sq.m. (it was 30 meters from the gate to the main housing), and was provided many servants and even policemen for the security.

sen.j: 初代鴈治郎は「河村は大きな家に住んでよる。」と驚嘆したという。
sen.e: Ganjiro the first was amazed 'Kawamura lives in a huge house.'
It is said that the first Ganjiro was amazed saying 'Kawamura lives in a huge house' (Kawamura was the real name of the sixth UTAEMON Nakamura [son of the fifth UTAEMON Nakamura]).
It is said that the first Ganjiro was amazed saying 'Kawamura lives in a huge house' (Kawamura was the real name of the sixth UTAEMON Nakamura [son of the fifth UTAEMON Nakamura]).

sen.j: また、屋敷前のバス停も「歌右衛門邸前」とあった。
sen.e: The bus stop in front of the residence was also named 'the residence of Utaemon.'
The bus stop in front of the residence was also named 'the residence of Utaemon.'
The bus stop in front of the residence was also named 'the residence of Utaemon.'

sen.j: 芸談に『魁玉夜話』（安部豊編）がある。
sen.e: There is a talk on art "Kaigyokuyawa" (edit by Yutaka ABE).
His talks on the arts remain in "Kaigyoku Yawa" (edited by Yutaka ABE).
His talks on the arts remain in "Kaigyoku Yawa" (edited by Yutaka ABE).

sen.j: 墓所は多磨霊園。
sen.e: His graveyard is in Tama Cemetery.
His graveyard is in Tama Cemetery.
His graveyard is in Tama Cemetery.
